segments.text: I wish to make it clear at the outset that this matter of labels is entirely our problem .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I should say it is something we have never come across before .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The Federal Food and Drug Administration , or the FDA as we call it for short , imposes a whole set of regulations on the import of food products to the United States . Over the years , they have become so rigid and complicated that they are now quite a head - ache for us importers .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: In my opinion , overly strict regulations are just another way of restricting imports .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Ah , there's something in what you're saying . According to the present FDA regulations , the Ma Ling Labels then cannot be used if the lichee is to be offered for import into the United States .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why not ? Our cannedlichee and canned provisions have already been widely sold in various markets abroad , and the Ma Ling Label has now been accepted by most of overseas customers and importers . Is it quite impossible for you to use the Ma Ling labels as they are ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'd be quite willing to if I could , but we must comply with the label requirements according to our law , or we can't clear the consignment of lichee through the Customs .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: In that case , what can we do to help you ? Have you any suggestions ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Would you consider quoting us for the order with neutral cans on a C . I . F . basis for delivery in Hong Kong ? Our associated company there will have the labels printed to comply with the FDA regulations .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you think that's the only way out ? You know we usually do the labeling , as we are responsible for the brand labels of our products .
segments.speaker: S2
